definition: to plan and prepare
chip (in gambling)/token (for counting)/ticket/to prepare/to plan/to raise (funds)/resource/means
to cut/to slash/to scratch (cut into the surface of sth)/to strike (a match)
to row/to paddle/profitable/worth (the effort)/it pays (to do sth)
to delimit/to transfer/to assign/to plan/to draw (a line)/stroke of a Chinese character

sentences.english: Michael Vick is being indicted again for staging dogfights.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔Vick由于筹划斗狗再次遭到起诉。

sentences.english: It now plans to build more pitches for students to play on.
sentences.chinese: 现在他们正在筹划建立更多的场地供学生们踢球。

sentences.english: HAGEE: That it was a city that was planning a sinful conduct, yes .
sentences.chinese: 那是一个筹划着罪孽行为的城市，是的。

sentences.english: A few days before the election, I went down to New York for a long-planned fund-raiser.
sentences.chinese: 选举日前几天，我去纽约参加一个筹划已久的筹款会。

sentences.english: To get anywhere, you need to be constructive. You have to make an effort.
sentences.chinese: 不论走到何种地步，都要积极筹划，付诸努力。

sentences.english: Experts say that while rotational grazing can save money over time , it also requires planning.
sentences.chinese: 专家称，虽然轮牧经济省钱，它也需要周密筹划。

sentences.english: Why do I sit down and devise schemes and invent plans?
sentences.chinese: 为什么我呆坐着设计筹划呢？

sentences.english: ETD leads to both micro-cosmic and macro-cosmic effects.
sentences.chinese: 企业税务筹划会产生宏观和微观双重效应。

sentences.english: But can education ever be mapped out in such prescriptive terms?
sentences.chinese: 但是教育真的可以被那样一板一眼地筹划吗？

sentences.english: Within Shanghai, there are two Metro linesand several more at the planning stages.
sentences.chinese: 上海市内已有两条城铁，正在筹划建设更多线路。

sentences.english: Sometimes it takes decidedly circuitous routes in planning our demise.
sentences.chinese: 有时候她果断而迂回曲折地筹划对我们的谋杀计划。

sentences.english: Tax planning is different from tax avoidance and tax evasions.
sentences.chinese: 纳税筹划不同于避税和偷税。

sentences.english: Common planning a blade etc FaChang and rescue the knife grain rob dragon.
sentences.chinese: 刀锋等人共同筹划着劫法场，救出刀纹龙。

sentences.english: I'm planning out the school debate.
sentences.chinese: 我正在筹划学校辩论会。
德凡正在筹划一场婚礼。

sentences.english: Song had worked at the same job for four years and had a project in mind when he quit.
sentences.chinese: 宋浩一份工作做了4年而且辞职的时候还有筹划。

definition: preparations/to get ready for sth
to work out a strategy/to come up with a plan for
to scheme/to plot/conspiracy
to draw up/to draft/to formulate
matters/arrangements
plan/project/program/to plan/to map out/CL:個|个[ge4],項|项[xiang4]
to discuss/to deliberate
(of alcohol) to ferment/(of a crisis) to be brewing/to mull over (an issue)/to hold exploratory discussions
to prepare to build sth
large scale program of lasting importance/project of paramount importance/to think big/annual national audit
to restructure/to reorganize/to revamp
to raise (money)
to arrange/to make preparations
to consult/to discuss seriously/to negotiate/to confer/negotiations/consultations
to plan to/to draft (a plan)/to imitate/to assess/to compare/pseudo-
doubtful/suspicious/variant of 擬|拟[ni3]/to emulate/to imitate
to agree/to decide after consultation/to come to a compromise
